Ingredients.1: 4  green bell peppers, tops and seeds removed (reserve tops)

Ingredients.4: 1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes with juice

Directions.1: Chop enough reserved green pepper tops to equal 1/4 cup; set aside. Discard remaining tops or use for another purpose.

Directions.2: Place hollowed-out green peppers in a microwave-safe dish; cover and cook in microwave until bright green and steaming, about 3 minutes. Set peppers aside.

Directions.3: Cook and stir ground beef in a skillet with onion and 1/4 cup chopped pepper tops over medium heat until beef is browned, the juices run clear, and the onion is translucent, about 10 minutes. Drain excess grease.

Directions.4: Pour in diced tomatoes with their juice, rice, water, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and black pepper; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover skillet, and simmer until rice is tender, about 30 minutes.

Directions.5: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Directions.6: Stir Cheddar cheese into ground beef-rice mixture and spoon mixture into precooked peppers. Set peppers upright in an 8x8-inch baking dish.

Directions.7: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and peppers are tender, about 30 minutes.
